qas.question: Who posthumously awarded his the Presidential Medal of Freedom?
When did President Johnson award him?
What is the Presidential Medal Freedom?

answers.text: the United States' highest civilian award

qas.question: When was President Johnson's speech for John XXIII?
What did Pope John XXIII award Lyndon B Johnson?
When was the award given to President Johnson?

plausible_answers.text: in recognition of the good relationship between Pope John XXIII and the United States of America

qas.question: Why was this award given by the Pope to Lyndon B. Johnson?
When did John XXIII give a speech for President Johnson?

plausible_answers.text: He was a man of simple origins, of simple faith, of simple charity

qas.question: How did Pope John XXIII describe Lynden B. Johnson?

context: <b5_0>On <a1_0>3 December 1963<b5_0/><a1_0/>, <a0_0>US President Lyndon B. Johnson<a0_0/> posthumously awarded him the Presidential <b4_0>Medal of Freedom<b4_0/>, <a2_0>the United States' highest civilian award<a2_0/>, <b6_0>in recognition of the good relationship between Pope John XXIII and the United States of America<b6_0/>. In his speech on <a3_0><b7_0>6 December 1963<b7_0/><a3_0/>, Johnson said: "I have also determined to confer the Presidential Medal of Freedom posthumously on another noble man whose death we mourned 6 months ago: His Holiness, Pope John XXIII. <b8_0>He was a man of simple origins, of simple faith, of simple charity<b8_0/>. In this exalted office he was still the gentle pastor. He believed in discussion and persuasion. He profoundly respected the dignity of man. He gave the world immortal statements of the rights of man, of the obligations of men to each other, of their duty to strive for a world community in which all can live in peace and fraternal friendship. His goodness reached across temporal boundaries to warm the hearts of men of all nations and of all faiths".
